results.title: A Loaf of bread
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Malcolm Otton
results.brief_description: Shows the whole process for the production of bread, beginning with the planting and harvesting of wheat and the milling of flour. After scenes showing the preparation of the dough, animated drawings show how the bread is carried through the oven on an endless belt, coming out baked and ready for delivery.

results.title: A Load of old rubbish; The World under our feet
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Dandelion = Pusteblume”.
Two episodes of the successful German children’s series Pusteblume. “A Load of old rubbish” - Many old things are thrown away simply because people don’t know what else to do with them. Peter Lustig shows us ways to reuse many things. Something new can be made, toys can be exchanged when they are no longer a favourite and many waste products, like glass bottles, can be reused, as long as we don’t just throw them away. “The world under our feet” - Somewhere in every town, there is always some digging going on. Cars and trains travel underground in tunnels with multiple exits. When this happens, the earth gets pushed upwards, just like a mole hill which can be so annoying in the middle of your garden. However, people make even bigger hills when they go looking for coal, ores or salt in the earth, since all the earth that is excavated during mining has to be put somewhere.

results.title: A Little summermusik
results.brief_description: A film pastorale set in the early summer near Elora, Ontario where music students practice out-of-doors. Lush green fields, towering elms and a rippling stream near an old farmhouse provide a rich setting for young musicians playing solo or together on flutes, strings, piano. Music has charm indeed when the mood is of lilac and the sweet pipings of spring.

results.title: A Little princess
results.creator_credit: Mark Johnson, Baltimore Pictures and Alfonso Cuaron
results.brief_description: From the beloved classic novel by the author of “The Secret garden” comes a wondrous film, filled with storytelling magic that unlocks imagination and inspires dreams. It is the story of Sara Crewe, a young girl who shares an exotic life with her devoted father in India until he is called to military service and Sara is sent to a strict New York boarding school. Sara’s natural exuberance is misunderstood and she gains an undeserved reputation as a troublemaker. She draws strength from knowing that to her father she will always be a little Princess. With courage, imagination and kindness, she overcomes the hardships that beset her and changes both her life and the fortunes of those around her. Cast includes Eleanor Bron, Liam Cunningham, Liesel Matthews, Rusty Schwimmer, Arthur Malet, Alison Moir.

results.title: A Little phantasy on a 19th century painting (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Isle of the Dead, by the 19th Century painter Arnold Boecklin, is the subject of this McLaren experimental film. The spectral island wakes to mysterious life, flickers in candlelight and fades again into the dark - the whole effect heightened by an interpretive musical score. Music, Louis Applebaum. (Award: Salerno.)

results.title: A Little night music
results.creator_credit: Elliott Kastner, Sascha Wein Film, S&T-Film Berlin and Harold Prince
results.brief_description: Romantic comedy musical adapted from the Broadway stage play by Harold Prince and Stephen Sondheim, set in Vienna at the turn of the century. Stars Elizabeth Taylor, Diana Rigg, Len Cariou, Lesley-Ann Down, Hermione Gingold, Laurence Guittard. Features the well-known song “Send in the Clowns”. Screenplay by Hugh Wheeler.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Elliott Kastner, Sascha Wein Film, S&T-Film Berlin and Harold Prince

results.title: A Little life
results.creator_credit: Vicious Circle Productions and Deborah Howlett
results.brief_description: This program explores the life and death of a 19 year old Aboriginal youth who was shot while trying to escape from Canning Vale Remand centre in Perth. His death is one of 35 in Western Australia investigated by the Muirhead Royal Commission into Aboriginal Deaths in Custody. These facts alone cannot tell the story of Ricci Vicenti whose creativity, humour and sheer zest for life impressed everyone with whom he came in contact. This narrative documentary poses many questions about Australian society, its laws, its sense of justice, cross cultural attitudes and the experiences of Aboriginal people with the law. Ricci’s story is told by his mother and foster mother and juxtaposed with the news coverage of the time. A moving exploration of a rich but short life.

results.title: A Little joke
results.brief_description: A rift in the friendship of two girls develops when one girls tells a racist joke about the other. Lisa has a traditional Chinese dinner at the home of Nancy, her Chinese-American friend. When she returns home, her father and brother tease her about Chinese food, chopsticks and accents. Lisa repeats these jokes at school the following day and they are repeated in Nancy’s presence causing her to feel hurt. As Lisa witnesses more racial problems in the playground, she realises the impact of her ‘little joke’ and seeks out Nancy to make up.

results.title: A Little fable
results.brief_description: An intriguing animated film in which symbolic representation is used instead of realistic drawings. It tells the story of Charlie, an orange boy, whose blue friend is rejected by his mother. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
